snippet: Liberia remains desperately short on everything needed to halt the spread of Ebola, but an epidemiologist is working block by block to fill a crucial need: the support of residents.
abstract: Dr Mosoka Fallah, epidemiologist and immunologist who grew up in slums of Monrovia, Liberia, is racing to encourage trust in medical authorities in order to stop spread of Ebola virus; many residents are deeply distrustful of government and its faltering response to deadliest Ebola epidemic ever recorded.
lead_paragraph: Liberia remains desperately short on everything needed to halt the spread of Ebola, but an epidemiologist is working block by block to fill a crucial need: the support of residents.

headline.main: Back to the Slums of His Youth, to Defuse the Ebola Time Bomb
headline.print_headline: Back to the Slums of His Youth, to Defuse the Ebola Time Bomb
